headline: Creamy Chicken Marsala
description: Cream of mushroom soup and Marsala wine combine into a sauce for chicken, mushrooms, and onion in this simple dinner idea.
name: Creamy Chicken Marsala
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into cubes
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper; cook in hot oil until browned, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir onion and mushrooms with the chicken; continue cooking until the onion is translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Pour cream of mushroom soup and Marsala wine over the chicken mixture; cook until hot and the chicken is no longer pink in the middle, 3 to 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: It’s good. Easy to prep and cook.

This was super tasty! I made it with German egg noodles and since I didn’t have marsala wine, I used Pinot Grigio and brandy. SO good and my hubby loved it! Definitely a make again meal - the 20 minute total prep plus cook was spot on!

This recipe was great! It's simple, easy to make and quick. It was absolutely delicious. I like garlic powder so I added some of that to my recipe. I served it over riced cauliflower. This was a low cal dinner that tasted absolutely delicious!!

Very good actually. I did read other reviews but still decided to find out on my own. I noticed that it was a little soupy, but I personally like more sauce when it comes to this kind of dish. I didn't notice the overpowering taste of onion until the next day so next time I'll cut the small onion into half. If you wanted to thicken the broth some just add a little more cream of mushroom soup to it. I also added garlic, and opted for season salt, garlic powder, and black pepper instead of just salt and pepper.

Easy to fix. Will use real Marsala wine instead of marsala cooking wine which has little taste in dish when finished. Added 5 oz of heavy cream. Final result was satisfactory except very liquid. Wanted a thicker sauce. Served with spaghetti pasta instead of white rice.
Very good! I just happened to have 1 cup of Marsala in my pantry, so I thought I would give it a try. Well worth the time! I served it over hot broccoli and my husband loved it!
Too much onion flavor. Very thin, needed a thicker sauce
I used turkey cutlets, left them whole, used regular sliced mushrooms, and it was delicious!
Was really creamy tasty. I did double the recipe. And added 1 cup of heavy cream
Very simple yet delicious. We served it over spiral zucchini.
I’ve made this using the recipe exactly as written and it never fails to be a family and guest pleaser??
Very east and tasty!
It was so good..I'll definately make this one again
I had to add cornstarch to the pan as it was too soupy. The sauce was bland.

Made this last might, my wife and I both liked it. I Didn't have Marsala wine on hand, I used Rhine wine instead. Other than that it was made as written. It's a keeper. In the future I might use cream of celery or cream of chicken soup.
So easy and delicious. Will be making this for next dinner party. Great as leftovers as well.

This was good if you want to make a very quick and easy version of chicken Marsala. I was very appreciative of how little effort it took to throw it all together. However, I have found that the recipes that actually use heavy whipping cream in place of the cream of mushroom soup, as well as include some sherry as well taste absolutely amazing and give more quality flavor. I’ll definitely keep this around for something that can be made quickly.
I added a drained can of spinach to make it a one dish meal. I served it over angel hair pasta.
I added a drained can of spinach to make it a one dish meal. I served it over angel hair pasta.

This meal is absolutely delicious! I followed suggestions made by others. I used boneless chicken thighs and dredged them in flour before frying. I didn’t have any Marsala wine, so I used Sherry. Fresh rosemary, basil, garlic. You definitely need to add more seasoning to make it your own. Definitely will make again! Next time I will used fried pork chops!

I added parsley and sliced celery
Loved it
Very easy sat nite meal and delicious
Fast, easy and taste great. Added basil at the end. Served over a bed of cuscus.
perfect!
this was so easy to make. The taste was very good.

Subbed a sweet red dessert wine for the marsala wine because I was too lazy to go to the grocery store! Also added a healthy pinch of sriracha salt to give it a little more kick than the black pepper added (seriously...try this stuff). Served over white rice with some garlic bread. So easy, and so quick. Even the clean-up wasn't painful!

Love the addition of cream of mushroom soup. My change was flouring the chicken before browning. The sauce was very thick so I added beef broth as it cooked and I served it over white rice instead of pasta. My guests loved it and they all asked for the recipe. Thank you!
A little blah for my taste. Used cooking marsala may be the issue.

Really liked this approach to a quicker version of chicken Marsala. I would make two changes:
1.) A little less Marsala wine might make it better; it was a bit overwhelming using a full cup. Next time I'll try 3/4 C.
2.) I added cooked peas while plating it. This worked out very well.
Quick and easy recipe for Chicken Marsala. Full of flavor. Sprinkle with herb of your choice before serving to make more visually appealing.
Delicious, didn't change a thing! Great over rice!

Quick, easy, and delicious chicken Marsala. I've made this dish using other cream sources such as mascarpone and mustard, but the cream of mushroom is simpler and works well with the fresh mushrooms in this recipe. I didn't have any fettuccine or rice on hand so I ate it with toasted hamburger buns. Delicious!

I used sirloin steak that I brushed with olive oil and fresh minced garlic on both sides. Let marinade in refrigerator 3 hrs. Grilled steak and topped with Marsala sauce. Hubby loved it and will definitely make again

Very easy and very good. I followed the recipe, sort of. Two suggestions I picked up from other reviews were using the fat free cream of chicken soup and the ½ cup chicken broth and ½ cup of Marsala wine and I am glad I did. I did dredge the chicken breast in flour mixed with the ground pepper and ½ tsp. of garlic powder. Doubled the mushrooms using 8 ounces and also used a whole shallot chopped fine instead of the onion. I browned the chicken separately , removed and set aside. Then saute'd the shallots, some fresh garlic minced and the mushrooms. Added the Marsala, chicken broth and chicken soup, blended well in the same skillet, brought to a light boil, turn down to simmer then returned chicken to the skillet. Let it simmer about 5-6 minutes. Perfect! Chicken does not get over cooked this way.

My family loved this recipe! It is not chicken marsala, but it is reminiscent of those wonderful flavors enough, and so easy to make, that if you like chicken marsala I think you will be very pleased with this quickie alternative.

I put this over linguine, the creamy sauce working very well with the flat pasta. It was also quite delicious the next day as leftovers, easily warmed in a microwave.
Omg, so good! I served it with whipped potatoes and green peas. Super easy and delicious to boot!
Very good and easy!
Delicious!
I used a Cabernet and button mushrooms. It was delicious. I used breast meat and it came out a little dry. That is a chance you take when using breast meat. Next time I'll try thigh and leg meat.

Recipe calls for too much Marsala I feel it was very overpowering. To fix I added another half a can of cream of mushroom soup and some chicken stock and let it simmer. Next time I intend to half the amount of wine requested. Otherwise, very quick and tastey weekday meal! :)

Very good! I coated with flour before browning. Other then that everything else the same. Served with masked potatoes. Favorite Marsala recipe! Gave it 4 stars I feel like it needs a kick of something. Next time I think I'll add some red pepper flakes.
This was so delicious and QUICK!! I substituted the green pepper for a pepper and onion blend, and it gave it more flavor!! Most definitely making this again!!

Super easy one-pot dish. I used 99% fat free cream of mushroom soup, added rosemary flakes, substituted a cheap Merlot for the Marsala wine, and used sliced baby bella mushrooms instead of cremini. Served with rice and green beans (which were both cooked in the microwave, hence the one pot!)

It is hard to please everyone in my family but this recipe took care of all but one for dinner tonight. I tried other Marsala recipes but this one was a much bigger hit. Will definitely add to the rotation.

Per a few other reviews, I added rosemary and parsley flakes - i do believe they really helped bring out some flavor. No mushrooms b/c the hubs doesn't like them. Served over rice and it was delicious!
Loved it but I also made a varient using white cooking wine instead that my children much prefer. Awesome used as a gravy over mashed potatoes.
This was okay. Not spectacular, just okay

I liked this recipe. I substituted Publix baby bellas for the mushrooms and used low sodium cream of mushroom, which made the sauce a little runnier than I expected. I used some Wondra flour to thicken it a little bit and added some garlic powder.

Super-easy take on Chicken Marsala...which is probably my family's favorite meal. I normally do one that is labor-intensive and this one is perfect for lending the marsala flavor when I don't have time to make my usual version. The only substitution I made was to use 1/2 cup chicken broth and 1/2 cup marsala, and added a spring of rosemary while it simmered.Quick and yummy. I served over egg noodles. Thanks for the recipe!

I was doubtful, but it's delicious! I used regular mushrooms, diced garlic, no onions, and pino noir because that's all I had, and it worked out great. My kids (9,8,4) are devouring it, and it was so easy they helped me make it. I served it with mashed potatoes.
It was a great recipe but I did add sweet red and yellow peppers ,plus instead of cream of mushroom soup I used cream of chicken soup. My family loved it!! Glad I stumbled upon it. :-)
It would have been too bland, but I gussied it up with a pinch of fresh rosemary and parsley, and added more salt and pepper.
Delicious! Follow chefj changes!

I made this, but instead of a basic salt and pepper seasoning, I used emeril's essence mixed with 1/2 cup flour and dredged the chicken in that. It was crazy good. My picky 14-year-old had two helpings. I paired it with green beans almondine and roasted red potatoes.
I usually don't care too much for recipes made with wine but this one is excellent. I will be making it again.

Easy! Quick! Delicious! This is a keeper. I've made this a couple times. I've used both reduced fat cream of mushroom and regular. They both work fine. I've substituted whatever kind of mushroom I have on hand or on sale. Recipe is fine using less oil than listed. For a quick week night meal I serve it with our favorite instant mashed potato or instant mashed sweet potatoes.
lovely

made this recipe as written. Way too much marsala and chicken was very bland. Made it again with minor tweeking. I seasoned the chicken before browning and used 1/2 the Marsala. At the end I stirred in 1/2 cup sour cream. Served over fettucine..With changes it was much better.

Excellent. Changes...I used thighs and fried in pan with skin on. Removed thighs from pan and removed skin. Drain fat and add 2 TBLS butter and sauté onions and fresh mushrooms. Add in soup, wine and 1 cup chicken broth - return chicken to pan and simmer for 45 minutes.
PERFECT!
Super easy! I've made this recipe of times. My teenagers love it.
A wonderful and quick dish, just what I was looking for to use some pantry items. I used fresh button mushrooms I had on hand. Served with mashed potatoes.

This was so easy and so good! Followed the recipe exactly except I let it simmer covered for about 45 minutes - steam built up under the lid and caused the sauce to be a little thin. Next time I'll either leave the lid off or vent it. I served it over brown rice - my son said the leftovers where even better the next day. Will be making this one again! Thanks for sharing!

I made half of this recipe, and we thought it was very good! I served it over sticky rice for a very satisfying meal! I would definitely make this again. It was easy and tasty. Thanks for this recipe!

This was an incredibly easy recipe and tasted great! I added a bit of truffle oil with the mushrooms and needed to season the sauce a bit more with salt and pepper even after seasoning the chicken but it was great!

This recipe was the most flavorful Chicken marsala I have made in a long time.It was so simple without having to dredge the chicken in flour but still able to aquire the taste I wanted.Use fat free cream of mushroom soup for less calories and it was just delicious.I will be making this again for sure.

As I live in Japan, I had to substitute some of the ingredients because I couldn't get Marsala wine or the mushrooms. I used "Akadama" which is a sweet red wine and I substituted "shitake" mushrooms for the cremini mushrooms. I gave it 4 stars, but my partner, who is Japanese would give it 2.5 stars and the reason is that the first few bites are really delicious, but after that, the flavor is a bit "persistent". (Japanese people, in general, prefer more delicate flavors...) I would definitely make this again. It was quick and easy! For the pasta, I used "fresh" fettucini pasta.
